title: India Gets US Court Summons In Alleged Plot To Murder Khalistani Terrorist
content: A US court has summoned the Indian government after Khalistani terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun filed a civil lawsuit, alleging a plot to murder him.
summary: A US court has summoned the Indian government after Khalistani terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun filed a civil lawsuit, alleging a plot to murder him.

title: Exploding Pagers To Spraying Poison: A Look At Covert Israeli Ops
content: Lebanon has blamed Israel for the sabotage of thousands of pagers that caused them to explode, killing several people and wounding thousands, in an apparent bid to weaken the Islamist militant group Hezbollah.
summary: Lebanon has blamed Israel for the sabotage of thousands of pagers that caused them to explode, killing several people and wounding thousands, in an apparent bid to weaken the Islamist militant group Hezbollah.

title: UK Bank Warns Of AI Voice Cloning Scams Targeting Millions
content: The bank said that these scams are highly effective, with millions of people potentially at risk.
summary: The bank said that these scams are highly effective, with millions of people potentially at risk.

title: Canada Tightens Restrictions On International Students, Indians To Be Hit
content: Canada has announced to further reduce the number of study permits it will grant to foreign students in a bid to bring down the number of temporary residents.
summary: Canada has announced to further reduce the number of study permits it will grant to foreign students in a bid to bring down the number of temporary residents.

title: Zimbabwe To Cull 200 Elephants To Feed Its Citizens Amid Drought
content: The decision follows Namibia's recent move to cull elephants and other wildlife to address food insecurity worsened by a prolonged drought.
summary: The decision follows Namibia's recent move to cull elephants and other wildlife to address food insecurity worsened by a prolonged drought.

title: Ex CIA Officer Who Drugged, Sexually Abused Women Jailed For 30 Years
content: The investigation into Brian Jeffrey Raymond began in 2020 when a naked woman was seen screaming for help from the balcony of his residence in Mexico City.
summary: The investigation into Brian Jeffrey Raymond began in 2020 when a naked woman was seen screaming for help from the balcony of his residence in Mexico City.

title: 32 Killed, Over 3,250 Injured As Walkie-Talkies, Pagers Explode In Lebanon
content: At least 32 people were killed and more than 3,250 injured as walkie-talkies and pagers used by Hezbollah members blew up in its strongholds across Lebanon in the last two days, stoking fears of an all-out war with Israel.
summary: At least 32 people were killed and more than 3,250 injured as walkie-talkies and pagers used by Hezbollah members blew up in its strongholds across Lebanon in the last two days, stoking fears of an all-out war with Israel.

title: US Rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs Again Denied Bail In Sex Trafficking Case
content: Rap mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs will remain imprisoned pending trial on racketeering and sex trafficking charges, after a judge denied his appeal Wednesday.
summary: Rap mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs will remain imprisoned pending trial on racketeering and sex trafficking charges, after a judge denied his appeal Wednesday.

title: Israel Announces "New Phase" In Conflict With Hezbollah
content: Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant has said that Israel has entered a "new phase" in its conflict with Hezbollah in Lebanon, following two days of explosions targeting communication devices across Lebanon.
summary: Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant has said that Israel has entered a "new phase" in its conflict with Hezbollah in Lebanon, following two days of explosions targeting communication devices across Lebanon.

title: Fed Rate Cut Shows Economy "Very Bad Or They're Playing Politics": Trump
content: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump suggested the Federal Reserve was playing politics on Wednesday, after the US central bank announced a long-awaited interest rate cut of half a percentage point.
summary: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump suggested the Federal Reserve was playing politics on Wednesday, after the US central bank announced a long-awaited interest rate cut of half a percentage point.

title: Death Count In Lebanon Walkie-Talkie Blasts Rises To 20
content: The death toll from a second wave of explosions of electronic devices in Hezbollah strongholds in Lebanon on Wednesday rose to 20 with more than 450 people wounded, the country's health ministry said.
summary: The death toll from a second wave of explosions of electronic devices in Hezbollah strongholds in Lebanon on Wednesday rose to 20 with more than 450 people wounded, the country's health ministry said.

title: Canada To Further Cut Permits For International Students, Foreign Workers
content: Canada is further reducing the number of study permits it will grant to foreign students and tightening eligibility for work permits in a bid to cut down on the number of temporary residents in the country, the government said on Wednesday.
summary: Canada is further reducing the number of study permits it will grant to foreign students and tightening eligibility for work permits in a bid to cut down on the number of temporary residents in the country, the government said on Wednesday.

title: US Alleges Iranian Hackers Sent Stolen Trump Info To Biden Campaign
content: US authorities on Wednesday said Iranian cyberattackers had offered "stolen, non-public" material from Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's campaign to staff for his then White House rival, Joe Biden.
summary: US authorities on Wednesday said Iranian cyberattackers had offered "stolen, non-public" material from Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's campaign to staff for his then White House rival, Joe Biden.

title: Harvey Weinstein Pleads Not Guilty To New Sex Crime Charge
content: Disgraced Hollywood movie producer Harvey Weinstein pleaded not guilty on Wednesday to a new sex crime charge in New York.
summary: Disgraced Hollywood movie producer Harvey Weinstein pleaded not guilty on Wednesday to a new sex crime charge in New York.

title: China Will Be "High On Agenda" At Quad Summit: White House
content: China will certainly be "high on the agenda" at the Quad Summit set to be hosted by US President Joe Biden in Delaware's Wilmington on September 21, US National Security Council (NSC) Coordinator for Strategic Communications John Kirby said.
summary: China will certainly be "high on the agenda" at the Quad Summit set to be hosted by US President Joe Biden in Delaware's Wilmington on September 21, US National Security Council (NSC) Coordinator for Strategic Communications John Kirby said.

title: US House Subpoenas Blinken Over Afghanistan On September 24
content: The U.S. House of Representatives Foreign Affairs Committee subpoenaed Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Wednesday to appear before it on Sept. 24 over the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan in 2021.
summary: The U.S. House of Representatives Foreign Affairs Committee subpoenaed Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Wednesday to appear before it on Sept. 24 over the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan in 2021.

title: X Update Allows App To Bypass Brazil Ban: Internet Providers
content: Elon Musk's X social network carried out an automatic update overnight on phone applications that allowed it to bypass a ban in Brazil, an association of internet providers said Wednesday.
summary: Elon Musk's X social network carried out an automatic update overnight on phone applications that allowed it to bypass a ban in Brazil, an association of internet providers said Wednesday.

title: US Seeks $100 Million From Owner Of Ship That Destroyed Baltimore Bridge
content: The US Justice Department filed a lawsuit on Wednesday seeking more than $100 million from the Singapore owner and operator of a cargo ship that destroyed a Baltimore bridge.
summary: The US Justice Department filed a lawsuit on Wednesday seeking more than $100 million from the Singapore owner and operator of a cargo ship that destroyed a Baltimore bridge.

title: Fears Of All-Out War As New Lebanon Device Blasts Kill Dozens
content: A second wave of device explosions killed 14 people and wounded more than 450 others on Wednesday in Hezbollah strongholds in Lebanon, officials said, stoking fears of an all-out war with Israel.
summary: A second wave of device explosions killed 14 people and wounded more than 450 others on Wednesday in Hezbollah strongholds in Lebanon, officials said, stoking fears of an all-out war with Israel.

title: Iran's New President Names First Sunni Governor In 45 Years: Report
content: Iran's new president, Masoud Pezeshkian, on Wednesday nominated a member of the Sunni Muslim minority to be governor of Kurdistan province, official media reported.
summary: Iran's new president, Masoud Pezeshkian, on Wednesday nominated a member of the Sunni Muslim minority to be governor of Kurdistan province, official media reported.
